results.title: Building belief. Pt. 1
results.creator_credit: Dana H. Hodgdon, Bernice Gregorio and Northwestern University Film Library
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Heathcote Teaching series”.
This film shows England’s outstanding drama educator, Dorothy Heathcote, working with nine and ten year old American children. She uses drama as a means of teaching social studies. Suitable for teachers and tertiary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dana H. Hodgdon, Bernice Gregorio and Northwestern University Film Library

results.title: Dorothy Heathcote talks to teachers. Pt. 1 (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Dana H. Hodgdon, Bernice Gregorio and Northwestern University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Heathcote Teaching series”.
In a teachers’ workshop, Dorothy Heathcote, England’s outstanding drama educator, explores the theory of improvised drama as a teaching tool for all classroom teachers. She analyses her unique process, explaining and illustrating techniques for developing materials, the use of dramatic elements and the segmenting of ideas to achieve dramatic focus.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dana H. Hodgdon, Bernice Gregorio and Northwestern University

results.title: Stories for Everyone
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Butler’s Video Books”.
A video designed to encourage children to read and enjoy books. Ten different stories, many from well known books, are told by professional storytellers and have been selected for children aged five to eight years old.

results.title: Seaside Stories = Gumdrop makes a start and nine other ...
results.creator_credit: Gerben Cath and International Video Books
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Butler’s Video Books”.
Dorothy Butler introduces this video which is designed to encourage children to read and enjoy books. Storytellers, John Hawkesby and Phillipa Dann tell a small group of children ten stories, many from well known books, as they enjoy a day beside the sea. The stories are: Gumdrop makes a start, Dinosaurs and all that rubbish, Pa’s top hat, Spacers space rescue service, Lift off to danger, The frog prince, Alex’s bed, Ice creams for Rosie, Master Money the millionaire and Sam and the dog from the sea.

results.title: Timeless stories = The Witch and the owl ...
results.creator_credit: Gerben Cath and International Video Books
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Butler’s Video Books”.
Dorothy Butler introduces this video designed to encourage children to read and enjoy books. Ten different stories, many from well known books, are told by professional storytellers and have been selected for children aged eight to eleven years old. The stories are: “The Musicians of Bremen”, “The Writing on the wall”, “Did you ever?”, “Chanticleer”, “Mr. and Mrs. Hay the horse”, “Mabel’s story”, “The Witch and the owl”, “Funnybones” and “Jorinda and Joringel”.
results.title_for_label: Timeless stories = The Witch and the owl …

results.title: Stories afloat = lighthouse keeper's lunch
results.creator_credit: Gerben Cath and International Video Books
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Butler’s Video Books”.
A video designed to encourage children to read and enjoy books. Ten different stories, many from well known books, are told by Dorothy Butler and Don Kjestrup as they take a group of children for a sail in a yacht. The stories have been selected for children aged eight to eleven years old. The stories are: “A bag of wind”, The magic apple”, Scruffy, scruffy dog”, “Mrs. Vineagar” “Shuttle burn”, “Mrs. McGinty and the bizarre plant”, “Gumdrop and the farmer’s friend”, “Pelican”, “Rapunzel” and “The lighthouse keeper’s lunch”
results.description:

The stories are: “A bag of wind”, The magic apple”, Scruffy, scruffy dog”, “Mrs. Vineagar” “Shuttle burn”, “Mrs. McGinty and the bizarre plant”, “Gumdrop and the farmer’s friend”, “Pelican”, “Rapunzel” and “The lighthouse keeper’s lunch”

results.title: Stories on a train = The Tale of Georgie Grub ...
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Butler’s Video Books”.
A video designed to encourage children to read and enjoy books. Ten different stories, many from well known books, are told by professional storytellers and have been selected for children aged five to eight years old. Introduced by Dorothy Butler. The stories are: “Troublesome pig”, ” The Grand old Duke of York”, “Grandma goes shopping”, “Lucky Hans”, “On Friday something funny happened”, “Wolf! Wolf!”, “The Tale of Georgie Grub”, “Everybody said no!”, “Mr. Biff the boxer” and “The Trouble with Jack”.
